name: mossy walk socks
notes:
gabriela from moss fibers is an amazing person, and she has also been a cheerleader of mine since way before my designing days, so i wanted to create a pattern in her honor. her soft cashmere base and exquisite color choices make her yarns the ones i reach for when i feel like wrapping myself in the comfiest, coziest stuff imaginable, and the socks they produce are the most luxurious i've ever had the pleasure to wear.

the mossy walk socks are comprised of moss stitch and a few tiny cables, meant to evoke a mossy cobblestone pathway through a garden. it is knit from the cuff down with a heel flap and gusset.


sizes
s (m, l) / 56 (64, 72) sts
fits approximate foot circumference of 7 (8, 9)” / 17.5 (20, 22.5)cm

yarn
moss fibers luxe fingering (80% merino wool, 10% cashmere, 10% nylon) in colorway envy
452yds/413m per 100g skein

needles
us 1/2.25mm circular needle with 32-inch cable for magic loop
or your preferred method for sock knitting

gauge
32 sts x 48 rounds in stockinette stitch over 4” x 4” / 10cm x 10cm, after blocking

notions
3 stitch markers
cable needle (optional)
tapestry needle
